intro: Roldana kerberi var. manantlanensis, commonly known as the Manantlan roldana, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the high-altitude regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and clustered inflorescences. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, daisy-like yellow flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
